## The 'Move Response' is limited
<hr>

**<span style="color:blue">Move</span>: movement of individuals (dispersal, migration), populations or species (range changes).**

<br/>

**<span style="color:red">Move</span>: movement away from natal territory (typically before or during reproduction - can be gametes not individuals)**

<br/>

**Dispersal is a key trait that influences move response. Can be short or long distance -  All species (even sessile ones) can disperse, but species differ in their dispersal ability.**

<br/>

**Dispersal links/limits individual movement with range shifts**

## Range changes
<hr>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

**<span style="color:green">Geographic range</span>= total spatial area in which a species is found**

<br/>

**Range changes can be facilitated by individuals themselves moving**

<br/>

**For example: individuals following food resources, altering migratory pathways, etc.**

<br/>

**Can occur naturally (competition) or via move response or changes in survival rate**
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:180px; LEFT:550px; WIDTH:600px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/birdsmigrate.jpg">

## Range changes are usually slow

## Factors that influence the move response
<hr>

**Whether or not species can “move” as a response to global change stressors depends on many things…**

<br/>

**Organismal traits: Ability to move in response to changing conditions can be affected by many intrinsic traits like dispersal ability, generation time, etc.**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:380px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:1000px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/animalmove.png">

## Factors that influence the move response
<hr>

**Whether or not species can “move” as a response to global change stressors depends on many things…**

<br/>

**Landscape features: Ability to move in response to changing conditions can be affected by many *characteristics of the environment* like habitat matrix (connectedness)**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:380px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:1000px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/landscape.png">

## Factors that influence the move response
<hr>
